intro: Veronica spicata var. legitima, commonly known as the upright speedwell, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It features upright, spike-like inflorescences composed of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant has slender, branching stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens and its ability to attract pollinators.
